metadata.title: CVE-2017-17506 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In HDF5 1.10.1, there is an out of bounds read vulnerability in thefunction H5Opline_pline_decode in H5Opline.c in libhdf5.a. For example,h5dump would crash when someone opens a crafted hdf5 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17506` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm1
hdf5-tools - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm1
libhdf5-7 - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm1
libhdf5-mpich2-7 - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm1
libhdf5-openmpi-7 - 1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.11-5ubuntu7.1+esm1').
